meanings.definition: A mass mailing of promotional material
meanings.sent1: The company sent out mailshots to all its customers.
meanings.sent2: I received a mailshot advertising the new products.
meanings.sent3: The mailbox was overflowing with mailshots, making it look like a paper jungle.
meanings.sent4: Her room was filled with stacks of mailshots, creating a colorful fortress of advertisements.
meanings.sent5: The mailshots flooded the neighborhood, turning every doorstep into a mini billboard.

meanings.definition: To send out promotional material in a mass mailing
meanings.sent1: She decided to mailshots to promote the upcoming sale.
meanings.sent2: They mailshot their latest offers to potential clients regularly.
meanings.sent3: The office staff joked that they should mailshot the office cat's birthday party.
meanings.sent4: He mailshots his ideas to the world, hoping for a positive response.
meanings.sent5: The politician mailshots promises to the voters, hoping to win their support.
